thread.title: Game Day: Arizona Coyotes host Minnesota Wild looking for 4-0 start
thread.title_full: Game Day: Arizona Coyotes host Minnesota Wild looking for 4-0 start

author: azcentral.com
title: Game Day: Arizona Coyotes host Minnesota Wild looking for 4-0 start
text:
Thursday night's game: Wild (2-0-0) at Coyotes (3-0-0).
Puck drop: 7 p.m.
TV/Radio: FSAZ/KTAR-AM (620).
The Coyotes are 3-0 for the first time since the 2003-04 season after a 4-0 win over the Ducks Wednesday.
“Even down to the last two or three minutes there, guys wanted to make sure we were doing the right things,” coach Dave Tippett said. “It was a solid effort, a solid effort all the way through.”
Winger Anthony Duclair had his first career hat trick against the Ducks.
“We’re a special group here in this locker room. It makes it that much more fun. The veterans here have done a great job of easing the young guys into the team, and big credit to them.”
AZCENTRAL
Arizona Coyotes XTRA app: Get latest news, scores
Credit the Coyotes’ speed as one of their strengths in each of their victories.
“I think that’s what we’ve been missing last year, all year long,” center Martin Hanzal said. “When you look at Max (Domi) and Toby (Rieder) and Duke (Duclair), they’re so fast. It’s actually fun to watch them skate with the puck and how they make those plays."
AZCENTRAL
Boivin: Coyotes wear 'blow up, rebuild' approach well
Fast facts for Thursday night’s game:
The Coyotes have outscored the opposition 10-2 and have yet to trail in a game. Goalie Mike Smith has stopped 104 of 106 shots. Hanzal paces the team with six points and has at least a point in all three games. The Coyotes penalty kill is a perfect 11-for-11. The Wild have been idle since beating the Blues 3-2 on Saturday. Winger Zach Parise leads the team with four goals. Minnesota has won five straight games against Arizona. Goalie Devan Dubnyk is one win shy of the 100th of his NHL career. Possible Coyotes lines
Domi-Vermette-Boedker
Rieder-Hanzal-Duclair
Chipchura-Richardson-Doan
Martinook-Gordon-Downie
Ekman-Larsson-Stone
Grossmann-Murphy
Dahlbeck-Michalek
Smith
Potential scratches: Vitale, Scott and Elliott.
Injury update: None.
Possible Wild lines
Parise-Granlund-Pominville
Zucker-Koivu-Niederreiter
Vanek-Coyle-Fontaine
Porter-Haula-Carter
Suter-Spurgeon
Brodin-Dumba
Scandella-Prosser
Dubnyk
Potential scratches: Graovac, Folin and Backstrom.
Injury update: Center Tyler Graovac (lower-body).
Reach the reporter at sarah.mclellan@arizonarepublic.com or 602-444-8276. Follow her at twitter.com/azc_mclellan.
